meanings.definition: Serving as an indication or sign.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were indicatory of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: Her frown was indicatory of her displeasure.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog was indicatory of the mailman's arrival.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence in the room was indicatory of something amiss.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's raised eyebrow was indicatory of trouble ahead.

meanings.sent1: The broken window was indicatory of a break-in.
meanings.sent2: His nervous tapping foot was indicatory of his anxiety.
meanings.sent3: The colorful decorations were indicatory of a festive occasion.
meanings.sent4: The old, creaky floorboards were indicatory of the house's age.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of baking was indicatory of a delicious treat.
